root_causes: Per-cell presence/range check does not allow the DK variable (B5eDKx5) as an alternative â€” the do repeat loop flags missing cells when the column is visible even if DK is selected.
Arithmetic relationship check (arith_err) is enforced unconditionally when column visible; it does not exempt the case where DK (B5eDKx5) is selected.
instructions:
In the per-cell do repeat loop, only require a numeric value (and range) when the column is visible AND DK is NOT selected. Replace the line:
  if (b5col5_vis = 1 and (miss(cell) or ~range(cell,0,9999))) cell_err = 1.
with something like:
  if (b5col5_vis = 1 and not (B5eDKx5 = 1) and (miss(cell) or ~range(cell,0,9999))) cell_err = 1.
This prevents missing-value errors when DK is selected.

Modify the arithmetic check so it is enforced only when DK is not selected. Replace the line:
  if (b5col5_vis = 1 and (miss(B5ex5_3) or abs(diff_b5ex5_3) > 0.0001)) arith_err = 1.
with something like:
  if (b5col5_vis = 1 and not (B5eDKx5 = 1) and (miss(B5ex5_3) or abs(diff_b5ex5_3) > 0.0001)) arith_err = 1.
This avoids arithmetic errors when the respondent chose DK.

Review any other required/missing checks that run unconditionally (e.g., missing_req logic is correct as written because it already checks not (B5eDKx5 = 1)). Ensure all presence/validation checks consistently exempt cases where B5eDKx5 = 1.
